product.name: Zero-Scout
product.vision: A lightweight, stateless web application designed to act as a real-time market intelligence tool for retail investors. Users can input natural language queries about their stock portfolio and receive instant news analysis without login.

epics.title: The Chat Interface (Frontend)
epics.description: Clean, minimalist chat UI with visual feedback and client-side chaining for multi-ticker queries.

epics.title: The Scrape-and-Paste Engine (Backend API)
epics.description: Serverless function to search DuckDuckGo, extract content, and analyze sentiment.

epics.title: The Response Formatter
epics.description: Display news cards with headlines, sentiment badges, and keyword-highlighted snippets.

features.title: UI & Input Handling
features.description: Input field for tickers and visualization of search status.

features.title: Client-Side Orchestration
features.description: Logic to parse queries and chain API calls with throttling.

features.title: Search & Extract API
features.description: Python endpoint to fetch news from DDG and extract text.

features.title: News Card Display
features.description: Frontend component to render news items with highlighting.

stories.title: Minimalist Chat UI
stories.description: As a user, I want a clean chat-like interface to enter my query.

stories.title: Query Parsing & Chaining
stories.description: As a user, I want my multi-ticker query (e.g., 'Google, Tesla') to be split and processed sequentially.

stories.title: DDG Search Integration
stories.description: As the system, I need to search DDG for the last 24h news for a given term.

stories.title: Content Extraction
stories.description: As the system, I need to extract body text from search results, ignoring ads.

stories.title: Sentiment Scoring
stories.description: As the system, I need to assign a polarity score and tag (Positive/Negative/Neutral).

stories.title: Result Cards with Highlighting
stories.description: As a user, I want to see news cards with bold financial keywords.

criteria: Query 'Google, Tesla' results in two separate sequences.
